member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.DatabaseExplorer.GetClickedListBoxItem
member.summary: Get the last item selected by multiple selection via mouse click.

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.DatabaseExplorer.ScrollToSelectedView
member.summary:
Scrolls the list of views until the selected view is one of the visible views.
This helps orient the user so they know where they're going if they scroll to the next or previous view.
In cases where the selected view is far off screen and its ListBoxItem may not exist because the ListBox is virtualized, this should force that item to exist, allowing focus and navigation to work as expected.

member.name: P:ViDi2.Training.UI.DrawingContext.ShowLabels
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to draw labels

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.Extensions.CheckDeploymentTargetCompatibilityUI(ViDi2.Training.IWorkspace,ViDi2.DeploymentTarget)
member.summary: Returns true if conversion did take place or no conversion was necessary, returns false if conversion was not possible, return null if user opted out of conversion.

member.name: F:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.BitmapEditorViewModel._drawingGroup
member.summary: Current set of drawing operations that can be rendered together for the opacity mask, representing the desired bitmap output. Note every child of this group is ALSO a DrawingGroup so it can be clipped by the Erase operation, then later moved to the history for undo.

member.name: F:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.BitmapEditorViewModel._history
member.summary: Past drawing operations. Each DrawingCollection is a cohesive set which can be rendered together.

member.name: T:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.ColoredClass
member.summary: Defines an association between class name and class color for a class in a tool's database.

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.ColoredClass.#ctor(ViDi2.Training.ITool,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a representation of a class in a tool's database.
member.remarks:
Classes should have unique names within a tool, but their colors do not need to be unique.
Changes to or will be replicated in the tool's database.
member.param: The tool in which the class is defined.
The (unique) name of the class.
The color used to consistently represent that class.

member.name: T:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel
member.summary: Represents the state of a RegionEditor, allowing one to label regions of one or more classes, each with their own name and color.

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel.#ctor(ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RedToolViewerViewModel)
member.summary: Initializes KnownClasses from the tool's current list of labeled regions.
member.remarks: If there are no known classes, a default class is added and selected instead, such that there is always at least one known class, and that there is always a selected class.

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel.DatabaseOnClassNameChanged(ViDi2.Training.ClassNameChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Listens for new changes in existing classes, updating the name of the corresponding ColoredClass in KnownClasses, so that the RegionEditor can reflect class renaming done elsewhere.
member.remarks: Throws an if it detects that one class has been merged into another outside of the RegionEditor. This is because by the time this event is received, the merge has already gone through; we're not yet sure what to do with labels that haven't been applied, whereas our can control what happens before it merges two classes.
member.param: The name of the affected class, as well as its new name.

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel.DatabaseOnClassColorChanged(ViDi2.Training.ClassColorChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Listens for new changes in existing classes, updating the color of the corresponding ColoredClass in KnownClasses so that the RegionEditor can reflect class color changes made elsewhere.
member.param: The name of the affected class, as well as the color it was changed to.

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel.ToolStatusOnPropertyChanged(System.Object,System.ComponentModel.PropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Listens for when the tool starts training or processing, raising PropertyChanged on the selected class' name. Additionally, CanExecuteChanged is raised for commands that can only execute while the tool is not busy.
member.remarks: This causes any controls that edit the select class' name to drop any unsaved changes, so that they don't try to commit those changes while the tool is busy (thus causing a hang).

member.name: P:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel.ShouldConfirmCurrentClassName
member.summary: Can be set to true to signal that we did something to the selected class name that the user might want to edit.

member.name: P:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel.KnownClasses
member.summary: The collection of classes that the tool already knows about (because they have been used to label at least one region in any view), or that we've created so that the user can start labeling regions of that class.

member.name: P:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel.SelectedClass
member.summary: The class to which new labeled regions will be assigned. Also, the class that will be manipulated when executing commands like .
member.remarks: There should always be a class selected. Before the selected class changes to another known class, we will prompt the user to apply unsaved labels, if any.

member.name: P:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel.ChangeClassColorCommand
member.summary: Changes color of the current class and all of its labeled regions.

member.name: P:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel.AddNewClassCommand
member.summary: Adds a new region class to the region editor and selects it.
member.remarks: The class will not be saved to the tool until at least one region is labeled with that class name and that label is saved via Apply.

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel.AddNewClass
member.summary: Creates a new class and adds it to . This class has a unique name, and uses the default color.

member.name: P:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel.EditClassNameCommand
member.remarks: The UI can bind (e.g. the focus of a textbox containing the current class name name) to , such that the UI enters "edit mode" when this command executes.

member.name: P:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel.MergeClassesCommand
member.summary: Merges the current class into another, such that all labeled regions of the current class become instances of the target class, creating a single class.

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.RegionEditorViewModel.MergeClasses
member.summary: Allows the user to designate a class as the merge target. Then, applies the same name and color as the target class to the current class, relabeling and recoloring all labeled regions of that class. Finally, removes the current class and replaces it with the combined class.
member.remarks: If there are unsaved labels for the current class, the user will be prompted to apply those changes. If the changes are not applied, the merge will not proceed.

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.ViewModels.BlueViewOverlayViewModel.CreateNodeModel
member.summary: Create a new Node Model, with all the currently selected features as nodes, or all features in the view as nodes if there are no selected features.

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.MarkingOverlayExtensions.SetupOverlayEnvironment(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize the WPF application, resources, and services that are required for creating overlay graphics in a non-WPF application. If this is called from a WPF application, it only initializes resources and services. Make sure to call if you are not in a WPF app.

Whether to re-initialize the instance if one already exists
Whether to add the WPF resources needed if they appear to already exist in the App Resources

member.name: T:ViDi2.Training.UI.XmlExclusionValidationRule
member.summary: Validation Rule used to ensure that there are no XML characters in a string

member.name: T:ViDi2.Training.UI.UniqueRegionClassNameValidationRule
member.summary: Defines a ValidationRule that ensures that a proposed name change for a class used to label regions in the RegionEditor is valid. This rule also ensures that the proposed class name isn't already used by any of the other existing regions being edited in the RegionEditor.

member.name: P:ViDi2.Training.UI.UniqueRegionClassNameValidationRule.RegionEditorViewModelContainer
member.summary: A DependencyObject with a DependencyProperty that holds a RegionEditorViewModel. This allows you to bind a viewmodel to this validation rule, which is otherwise not possible.
member.remarks: Note that this validation rule does not get executed whenever PropertyChanged is raised on this bound value; the rule only executes when trying to update the property the rule is actually in charge of validating (such as the contents of a textbox).

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.UniqueRegionClassNameValidationRule.IsNewClassNameValidAndUnique(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary:
Returns true if the proposed class (re)name is "valid," and if a class by that name does not already exist.
A class name is considered valid if: 1. It isn't empty or all whitespace. 2. The given collection of existing class names doesn't contain a different class with the proposed class name (with or without leading/trailing whitespace). Proposing the same exact name for the current class is considered valid. 3. The current class name and the proposed class name differ by more than just whitespace.
member.param: The name of the current class.
The new name being proposed for the current class.
The collection of existing classes to compare against for uniqueness.

member.name: M:ViDi2.Training.UI.UniqueRegionClassNameValidationRule.Validate(System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Validates the given proposed class name. The name is validated against the ViewModel's current and known classes.
member.param: The proposed class name (as a string).
Ignored
member.returns: A ValidResult if the proposed name is valid and unique.

member.name: T:ViDi2.Training.UI.RegionEditorViewModelContainer
member.summary:
Supports creating a validation rule with binding support (since you can't directly bind to properties on a ValidationRule).
See for the basic idea.
